title: Dealing with Norwegian Municipalities
text: package attempt dealing historical Norwegian municipalities. First, package uses cleaned version SSB’s overview historical changes municipality structure produce clusters municipalities can followed consistently two given years. Second, provides functions data link current historical municipalities (including different names spellings) municipality number. developed meet needs author coauthors. See documentation .

title: Dealing with Norwegian Municipalities
text: development version GitHub : current version package supports Norwegian municipalities, built .

title: Dealing with Norwegian Municipalities
text: Run commands years including 1980 2000.
code: print_changes(1980, 2000) #>     from   to year tidligere_kommunenavn #>  1:  102  105 1992             Sarpsborg #>  2:  114  105 1992               Varteig #>  3:  115  105 1992              Skjeberg #>  4:  130  105 1992                  Tune #>  5:  103  106 1994           Fredrikstad #>  6:  113  106 1994                 Borge #>  7:  131  106 1994               Rolvsøy #>  8:  133  106 1994              Kråkerøy #>  9:  134  106 1994                 Onsøy #> 10: 1940 1940 1994               Kåfjord #> 11: 2011 2011 1987            Kautokeino #> 12: 2021 2021 1988              Karasjok #> 13: 2025 2025 1992                  Tana print_clusters(1980, 2000) #>     muni_number      cluster #>  1:         102 cluster_0001 #>  2:         114 cluster_0001 #>  3:         115 cluster_0001 #>  4:         130 cluster_0001 #>  5:         103 cluster_0002 #>  6:         113 cluster_0002 #>  7:         131 cluster_0002 #>  8:         133 cluster_0002 #>  9:         134 cluster_0002 #> 10:        1940 cluster_0003 #> 11:        2011 cluster_0004 #> 12:        2021 cluster_0005 #> 13:        2025 cluster_0006 #> 14:         105 cluster_0001 #> 15:         106 cluster_0002 graph_clusters(1980, 2000) count_clusters(1980, 2000) #> [1] 6

Match Municipality Function — match_municipality
text: function takes data.table municipality details matches provided municipality name corresponding municipality number given year, using Jaro-Winkler string matching method. optional county number can specified.

title: Match Municipality Function — match_municipality
code: match_municipality(name, year = NULL, county_number = NULL, threshold = 0.1)

title: Match Municipality Function — match_municipality
text: name name municipality. year year (optional). provided, function match municipality irrespective year. county_number number county (optional). threshold minimum difference string distance best second best match.

title: Match Municipality Function — match_municipality
text: number municipality matches provided name (specified) year county number, well string distance municipality name list.

title: Match Municipality Function — match_municipality
code: if (FALSE) { df <- data.table(   municipality_name = c("Municipality1", "Municipality2", "Municipality3"),   municipality_number = c(1001, 1002, 1003),   year_created = c(1900, 1920, 1940),   year_stopped = c(1950, 1980, 2020) )  name <- "Municipality1" year <- 1930 county_num <- 10  match_municipality(df, name, year, county_num) }
